metadata.header_path: /FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 7 - Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations/
aws::graph::propositions: Working Capital and Cash Flow Analysis
Working capital is subject to many variables.
Working capital is subject to variability in demand.
Working capital is subject to inventory management.
Working capital is subject to category expansion.
Working capital is subject to the timing of cash receipts and payments.
Working capital is subject to customer payment terms.
Working capital is subject to vendor payment terms.
Working capital is subject to fluctuations in foreign exchange rates.
Cash provided by investing activities corresponds with cash capital expenditures.
Cash provided by investing activities corresponds with leasehold improvements.
Cash provided by investing activities corresponds with incentives received from property vendors.
Cash provided by investing activities corresponds with incentives received from equipment vendors.
Cash provided by investing activities corresponds with proceeds from asset sales.
Cash provided by investing activities corresponds with cash outlays for acquisitions.
Cash provided by investing activities corresponds with investments in other companies.
Cash provided by investing activities corresponds with investments in intellectual property rights.
Cash provided by investing activities corresponds with purchases of marketable securities.
Cash provided by investing activities corresponds with sales of marketable securities.
Cash provided by investing activities corresponds with maturities of marketable securities.
Cash used in investing activities was $49.8 billion in 2023.
Cash used in investing activities was $94.3 billion in 2024.
The variability in cash used in investing activities between 2023 and 2024 was caused primarily by purchases, sales, and maturities of marketable securities.
The variability in cash used in investing activities between 2023 and 2024 was caused primarily by cash capital expenditures.

metadata.header_path: /FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 7 - Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations/
/FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 7 - Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations/

text:
Working capital at any specific point in time is subject to many variables, including variability in demand, inventory management and category expansion, the timing of cash receipts and payments, customer and vendor payment terms, and fluctuations in foreign exchange rates.

Cash provided by (used in) investing activities corresponds with cash capital expenditures, including leasehold improvements, incentives received from property and equipment vendors, proceeds from asset sales, cash outlays for acquisitions, investments in other companies and intellectual property rights, and purchases, sales, and maturities of marketable securities. Cash provided by (used in) investing activities was $(49.8) billion and $(94.3) billion in 2023 and 2024, with the variability caused primarily by purchases, sales, and maturities of marketable securities and cash capital expenditures.
